missing.game.characters

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • missing.game.characters.Character
      • missing.game.characters.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, WorldTile.TileObject

    public class Player
extends Character
    This class represents individual players within the game world.
    See Also:

      • removeGivenAmountFromPocket

        public Movable removeGivenAmountFromPocket(Movable item)
                                    throws GameException
        Removes the first occurence of the passed item within the player's pocket. Removes the amount of the given item instead of all the items of that type in the pocket. Used for use item in client when food item is incorrectly produced
        Parameters:

      • removeFromInventory

        public Movable removeFromInventory(Movable item)
                            throws GameException
        Searches both the players bag and pocket for this specific item, and returns it if it is present. If the item is not present, it returns a null item.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        item that was removed.
        Throws:
        GameException

      • addToInventory

        public void addToInventory(Movable item)
                    throws GameException
        Adds the item to the pocket first, if that fails, it adds it to the bag. If that fails too, it throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Throws:
        GameException

      • removeFromBag

        public void removeFromBag(int index)
                   throws GameException
        Removes the specified item from the bag and shifts it to the pocket. If the pocket will be full after the transfer, the item will be placed back into the bag and it will notify the player that he/she needs to transfer some items into the bag.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Throws:
        GameException

        This method retrieves the tool with the lowest durability to ensure efficiency.

      • getFood

        public Food getFood()
        This method grabs the first Food object inside the player's pocket. If the player does not have any food, it returns null.
        Returns:
